title: Blippi Live is touring the country. But it's not the real Blippi and some parents are mad
text:
CLOSE

Blippi Live is coming to the Riverside on Feb. 23, but will be played by an actor rather than the YouTuber. (Photo: Blippi Live)

Preschoolers and their parents all over the world know Blippi. His goofy educational YouTube channel gets more than 200 million views per month, and he has more than 4 million followers.

Blippi recently announced his first Blippi Live! tour across North America, with stops at more than 30 cities across the country.

Ticket prices vary based on the city you live in, but prices for the first show in San Antonio, Texas range from $24 to $75. There's also an option to pay $50 for a meet-and-great after the show.

But, beware, you won't actually be meeting the real Blippi.

According to the description of the show, "Stevin John is the creator of Blippi and acts as the writer and creative force behind the Blippi character. Now that Blippi has evolved as a character he is excited that a dynamic stage performer has been cast as Blippi to entertain and thrill audiences across all the tour markets."

Uhhhh...OK.

Parents aren't too thrilled about this one and voiced their anger on social media, after finding out that they had just bought tickets to see someone other than Stevin John.

In case any parents are wondering the @blippi live show is not the real blippi, but an actor. I found this out after spending $160 on non-refundable tickets. Not cool @StevinWJohn. I'm 9ne disappointed momma. — Kelly (thefavesofourlives) (@TheIridescentA1) October 9, 2019

My kids love Blippi and I was excited to buy tickets to see him live...until I read the info stating that the real Blippi won’t even be there. What is this nonsense?! I’m not paying $150 for 4 tickets to see a Blippi imposter. #whymomismad — kristine (@kristine_wins) October 8, 2019
